edu.rit.m2mi
Class MethodInvoker

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.rit.m2mi.MethodInvoker
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public abstract class MethodInvoker
extends Object
implements Runnable

Class MethodInvoker is the abstract base class for a method invoker object. A method invoker implements interface Runnable. When its run() method is called, the method invoker calls a certain target method declared in a certain target interface. The target method is invoked on a certain target object. An actual method invoker class is a synthesized subclass of class MethodInvoker that has been customized for a certain target interface and target method. After constructing a method invoker instance, the M2MI layer specifies the target object and the arguments, if any, for the target method.

M2MI uses method invokers to perform the actual M2MI invocations on exported objects. By encapsulating the interface- and method-specific aspects of an invocation in the method invoker, the rest of the M2MI layer can be and is written in a generic fashion to work for any interface and any method.

M2MI Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Field Detail

myTarget

protected Object myTarget
This method invoker's target object.

myArguments

protected byte[] myArguments
Serialized arguments for this method invoker's target method, or null if there are no arguments.

Constructor Detail

MethodInvoker

protected MethodInvoker()
Construct a new method invoker. The method invoker initially has no target object and no method call arguments; these must be set before running the method invoker.

Method Detail

run

public abstract void run()
Invoke this method invoker's target method in the target interface. The method is invoked on the previously-set target object. The previously-set method arguments, if any, are used.

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable
Throws:
InvocationException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the method invocation was not successful.
